sel.block.tile

Tiles, also known as block entities, are blocks with additional data stored in an NBT tag.

License:
GNU General Lesser Public License v3

abstract class Tile: sel.block.block.Block;
A special block that contains additional data.

abstract pure nothrow @property @safe string minecraftSpawnId();
abstract pure nothrow @property @safe string pocketSpawnId();
Gets the tile's spawn id for Minecraft and Minecraft: Pocket Edition. They're usually in snake case in Minecraft (flower_pot) and in pascal case in Minecraft: Pocket Edition (FlowerPot).

abstract @property Compound minecraftCompound();
abstract @property Compound pocketCompound();
Gets the named binary tag. The tag may be null if the tile does not exists in the game's version or when the tile is in its inital state (or empty).

abstract void parseMinecraftCompound(Compound compound);
Parses a non-null compound saved in the Minecraft's Anvil format.

abstract void parsePocketCompound(Compound compound);
Parses a non-null compound saved from a Minecraft: Pocket Edition's LevelDB format.

final pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe bool placed();
Indicates whether the tile has been placed in a world.

Example:
if(tile.placed) {
   assert(tile.world !is null);
}


final pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe World world();
Gets the world the tile is placed in, if placed is true.

final pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe BlockPosition position();
Gets the tile's position in the world, if placed.

Example:
if(tile.placed) {
   assert(tile.tid == tile.world.tileAt(tile.position).tid);
}


abstract pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe ubyte action();
Gets the action type of the tile, used in Minecraft's UpdateBlockEntity packet.

abstract class Sign: sel.block.tile.Tile;
Sign with methods to get and set the text.

Example:
auto sign = world.tileAt!Sign(10, 44, 90);
if(sign !is null) {
   sign[1] = "Click to go to";
   sign[2] = "world";
   assert(sign[] == ["", "Click to go to", "world", ""]);
}


static immutable size_t FIRST_LINE;
static immutable size_t SECOND_LINE;
static immutable size_t THIRD_LINE;
static immutable size_t FOURTH_LINE;
Indicates the line.

@nogc @safe string[4] opIndex();
Gets the array with the text in the four lines.

Example:
sign[2] = "test";
assert(sign[] == ["", "", "test", ""]);


@safe string opIndex(size_t index);
Gets the text at the given line.

Params:
size_t index the line of the sign

Returns:
a string with the text that has been written at the given line

Throws:
RangeError if index is not on the range 0..4

Example:
d("First line of sign is: ", sign[Sign.FIRST_LINE]);


void opIndexAssign(string[4] texts);
Sets all the four lines of the sign.

Params:
string[4] texts four strings to be set in sign's lines

Example:
sign[] = ["a", "b", "", "d"];
assert(sign[0] == "a");


void opIndexAssign(string text);
Sets the given texts in every line of the sign.

Params:
string text the text to be set in every line

Example:
sign[] = "line";
assert(sign[] == ["line", "line", "line", "line"]);


void opIndexAssign(string text, size_t index);
Sets the text at the given line.

Params:
string text the new text for the given line
size_t index the line to place the text into

Throws:
RangeError if index is not on the range 0..4

Example:
string text = "New text for line 2";
sign[Sign.SECOND_LINE] = text;
assert(sign[Sign.SECOND_LINE] == text);


final @property @safe bool empty();
Checks whether or not every sign's line is an empty string.

Example:
if(!sign.empty) {
   sign[] = "";
   assert(sign.empty);
}


class FlowerPot: sel.block.tile.Tile;
A pot that can contain a plant.

pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe Item item();
Gets the current item placed in the pot. It may be null if the pot is empty.

Example:
if(pot.item is null) {
   pot.item = new Items.OxeyeDaisy();
}


@property Item item(Item item);
Places or removes an item from the pot.

Example:
pot.item = new Items.OxeyeDaisy(); // add
pot.item = null; // remove
